EmailTemplate.subject: Thank You for Joining Pivotal at JavaOne 2016
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
Hello,
Thank you for joining Pivotal and the Spring community at JavaOne <[[https://www.oracle.com/javaone/]]>. Hopefully you learned how enterprises are adopting Cloud Native application architectures to drive modern software experiences for their customers. If you’d like to arrange a hands on workshop at your offices or at a nearby hotel, simply inquire here <[[http://pivotal.io/cloud-native-workshop]]>.
In the meantime, start your Cloud Native journey to learn why it matters and what it looks like to become Cloud Native right here <[[https://pivotal.io/cloud-native]]>. Get started <[[https://pivotal.io/platform/pcf-tutorials/getting-started-with-pivotal-cloud-foundry]]> with Pivotal Cloud Foundry by deploying an app in a matter of minutes. And remember to pick up your free copy of the O’Reilly eBook, Migrating to Cloud Native Applications <[[http://pivotal.io/platform/migrating-to-cloud-native-application-architectures-ebook]]>.
In case you missed anything, here’s a quick recap (click to directly download JavaOne presentations):
- Java Champion Mark Heckler gave a number of excellent talks at JavaOne - This Stuff Is Cool, but HOW CAN I GET MY COMPANY TO DO IT??! <[[https://static.rainfocus.com/oracle/oow16/sess/1464807373578001uvcq/ppt/ConvinceYourCompany_v2.pdf]]> - Bundling Microservices to Optimize Consumption for Devices with Spring Cloud and Netflix OSS <[[https://static.rainfocus.com/oracle/oow16/sess/1464808445975001uWt6/ppt/Heckler_EdgeServices.pdf]]> - Microservices Minus the Hype: How to Build and Why <[[https://static.rainfocus.com/oracle/oow16/sess/1464808559038001uMX0/ppt/MicroservicesMinusTheHype_v4.pdf]]>
- Kenny Bastani, technical evangelist for Pivotal, had two talks at JavaOne
- Handling Eventual Consistency in JVM Microservices with Event Sourcing <[[http://www.slideshare.net/chris.e.richardson/handling-eventual-consistency-in-jvm-microservices-with-event-sourcing-javaone-2016]]> - A panel session on how The Cloud-Natives Are RESTless <[[https://static.rainfocus.com/oracle/oow16/sess/1462497825472001p5TI/ppt/JavaOne2016-CON2514-RESTLess-Combo.pdf]]>
- Martin Lippert, Spring Tool Suite lead developer, had two talks at JavaOne
- The Cloud Inside Your IDE <[[https://static.rainfocus.com/oracle/oow16/sess/1462553867374001ch4c/ppt/JavaOne2016-TheCloudInsideYourIDE.pdf]]> - Next-Level Spring Boot Tooling <[[https://static.rainfocus.com/oracle/oow16/sess/1462554480364001cKO9/ppt/JavaOne2016-NextLevelBootTooling.pdf]]>
Hungry for the latest in Spring, Pivotal and Cloud Foundry?
- Spring Blog: Notes on Reactive Programming Part I: The Reactive Landscape <[[https://spring.io/blog/2016/06/07/notes-on-reactive-programming-part-i-the-reactive-landscape]]> - Spring Blog: Reactive Programming with Spring 5.0 M1 <[[https://spring.io/blog/2016/07/28/reactive-programming-with-spring-5-0-m1]]> - Spring Blog: New in Spring Framework 5.0: Functional Web Framework <[[https://spring.io/blog/2016/09/22/new-in-spring-5-functional-web-framework]]> - Spring Blog: Spring Cloud Data Flow 1.0 GA release <[[https://spring.io/blog/2016/07/12/spring-cloud-data-flow-1-0-ga-released]]> - Pivotal POV blog: Now Available—Spring Cloud Services for Pivotal Cloud Foundry <[[http://blog.pivotal.io/pivotal-cloud-foundry/products/now-available-spring-cloud-services-for-pivotal-cloud-foundry?utm_source=InfoQ-sponsored-post-newsltr&utm_medium=sponsored-update&utm_campaign=infoq-spring-cloud-services-blog]]> - SpringOne Platform 2016 talk: Cloud Native Java <[[https://spring.io/blog/2016/09/12/springone-platform-2016-replay-cloud-native-java]]> with Josh Long - SpringOne Platform 2016 talk: The journey from monolith to microservices: a guided adventure <[[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Tx5h3hdvjfw]]> - SpringOne Platform 2016 talk: 12 Factor, or Cloud Native Apps: What EXACTLY Does that Mean for Spring Developers? <[[https://spring.io/blog/2016/09/12/springone-platform-2016-replay-12-factor-or-cloud-native-apps-what-exactly-does-that-mean-for-spring-developers]]> - SpringOne2GX 2015 talk: Spring Cloud At Netflix <[[https://blog.pivotal.io/pivotal-cloud-foundry/products/spring-cloud-helps-netflix]]>, Jon Schneider & Taylor Wicksell, Netflix
Stay in touch with the Spring Team and join the conversation on our blogs <[[http://spring.io/blog]]>, podcasts <[[http://blog.pivotal.io/podcasts-pivotal]]>, and on Twitter <[[https://twitter.com/springcentral]]>.
We hope to see you again soon at a future event <[[https://pivotal.io/news-events]]>!
Thanks, Pivotal and The Spring Team
